intro: Peritassa huanucana, commonly known as the Huanuco peritassa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, high-altitude environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in horticultural trade.
